results.title: Bean
results.creator_credit: Mel Smith, Eric Fellner, Peter Bennett-Jones, Tim Evans, NV Polygrams S A and PolyGram Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: In an attempt to get rid of their most inept and detested employee, Mr Bean, The Royal National Gallery of London send him to America to oversee the unveiling of America’s most treasured painting, ‘Whistler’s mother’. The staff of the Grierson Gallery in Los Angeles are not privy to the gallery’s rationale for sending Mr Bean, and still believe that they are dealing with a man of the finest intellect, the scholarly Dr Bean. While in America Mr Bean is billetted to stay with David Langley (Peter MacNicol), much to the annoyance of his family who seriously doubt his supposedly brilliant credentials. As Mr Bean unleashes his particular brand of behaviour, which inevitably ends in disaster, they too begin to wonder about the enigmatic Mr Bean. The most significant of his disasters includes destroying ‘Whistlers’ mother’, forcing him into panic mode to rectify the situation before he gives a speech at the grand unveiling. Cast also includes Mel Smith, Pamela Reed and Harris Yulin. Includes 20 minutes of unseen footage as well as interviews with Rowan Atkinson and Mel Smith.

results.title: Ulee's gold
results.creator_credit: Victor Nunez, Clinica Estetico and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: This touching film presents a subtle study of the difficulties and complexities involved in the development and maintenance of lasting human relations. It reveals how abnormal events force one self-exiled loner to reassess his moral and emotional beliefs and to redeem his sense of personal and familial strength. Ulee, a Vietnam veteran turned beekeeper, in the tradition of generations before him, watches his family disintegrate when his son, Jimmy, lands in jail for robbery and his daughter-in-law disappears, leaving their two daughters in Ulee’s care. Ulee takes refuge from this state of affairs in the production of his high-grade honey with the unspoken assistance of his youngest granddaughter. However, when Jimmy’s partners begin threatening his family, thinking that Jimmy has hidden the proceeds of their robbery, Ulee’s stubbornly suppressed sense of the unconditional bond and care that links his family begins to surface and he becomes involved in the tenuous situation. Nunez handles this film with a simplicity and sensitivity that effectively evokes the personal journey of Ulee and the rest of his family in challenging circumstances.

results.title: GI blues
results.creator_credit: Norman Taurog, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Elvis plays a singing GI, stationed in West Germany who has plans for life after the Army; opening a nightclub back home. The only problem is that he’s a bit short of cash and must take part in a wager to raise sufficient funds. The bet: he must melt the iceberg heart of a willowy cabaret dancer (Juliet Prowse). Complications arise when he begins to fall for her, and trouble can only ensue when she discovers the bet. Features the following songs: “GI Blues”, “Tonight is so right for love”, “Wooden heart” and “Blue suede shoes”. Cast includes Elvis Presley, Juliet Prowse, Robert Ives and Leticia Roman.

results.title: Fun in Acapulco
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: While in Acapulco, Elvis is pretty busy employed as a boat hand, lifeguard, and singer. He’s managed to capture the attention of a few of the local beauties (Ursula Andress, Elsa Cardenas), which fills in most of the spare time he has. He harbours a secret fear of heights however, after a fatal mishap during his career as a trapeze catcher leaves him shaken. Love manage to inspires him to overcome his fear of heights in the most public way possible - diving off a 136 foot cliff. Features the following songs: “Bossa Nova baby”, “You can’t say no in Acapulco”.

results.title: The Driver
results.creator_credit: Walter Hill, Lawrence Gordon, EMI/Parlophone and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Ryan O’Neal is the superstar getaway driver and Bruce Dern is the detective obsessed with capturing the speed maniac regardless of the costs. The Driver is well aware of the cop chasing him and leaves a tantalising trail of evidence in a game in which there can only be one victor. This film is notable for its high octane value, rather than a thoughtful character study with lots of dialogue. Cast also includes Isabelle Adjani as a gambler hired as an alibi for the driver.

results.title: Blazing saddles
results.creator_credit: Mel Brooks, Michael Hertzberg and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The land at Rock Ridge is worth a fortune, but strictly off limits to outside investors as the townsfolk already own their land. The only option is to drive them out by sending in the roughest, leanest, toughest gang you can muster and appoint a sheriff (Little) who is ill equipped to deal with their arrival. The black sheriff realises that the situation is out of his control and calls on a professional, one of the jail’s cons, who was also one of the fastest guns in the West. This is the overarching plot that serves as a vehicle for Mel Brook’s lunatic brand of humour aimed at a cineliterate audience. Includes Madeline Kahn’s Academy Award nomination performance in her Marlene Dietrich sendup. Cast includes Cleavon Little, Gene Wilder, Slim Pickens and David Huddleston. Screenplay by Mel Brooks, Norman Steinberg, Andrew Bergman, Richard Pryor and Alan Uger.

results.title: Barry Lyndon
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick, Warner Bros Pictures and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by William Makepeace Thackeray, Kubrick’s film portrays the rise and fall, in eighteenth century Ireland and England, of Barry Lyndon - an adventurer-gambler, a cad and a romantic idealist. The film follows Lyndon from his humble Irish heritage, through his ambitious and manipulative exploits to gain favour and power in the high echelons of society and then to his eventual rejection by, and resulting demise at the hands of the overtly hierarchical society he idealised. Kubrick departs from Thackeray’s picaresque novel in both scope and tone, replacing the first person narration of the novel with that of the third person, adding to a sense of detachment and abstraction. Meticulously designed and crafted with period detail and lit entirely by natural light in both interior and exterior settings, this film evokes a subtle yet striking sense and critique of the cultural rituals and trappings that pervaded eighteenth century life and its impact on human identity and values. (Awards: Best Art Direction/Set Decoration, Best Cinematography, Best Costume Design, and Best Adaptation. British Academy Awards for Best Director and Best Cinematography)

results.title: Basquiat
results.creator_credit: Julian Schnabel, Jon Kilik, Randy Ostrow, Sigurjon Sighvatsson and Eleventh Street Productions
results.brief_description: Basquiat chronicles the rise to artistic stardom of Jean Michel Basquiat, who in 1981, catapulted from being an unknown graffiti writer to one of the most successful and controversial artists in New York. Embraced by Andy Warhol, Basquiat degenerated into the party lifestyle and heavy drug use, never ceasing to detest the rich who, in his mind, did not really accept him for who or what he was. Cast includes Jeffrey Wright, Benicio del Toro, Michael Wincott, Claire Forlani, Dennis Hopper, David Bowie, Gary Oldman and Courtney Love.

results.title: Face/off
results.creator_credit: John Woo, Barrie M Osborne, Christopher Goosick, David Permut, Terence Chang, Douglas Reuter Productions and WCG Entertainment
results.brief_description: Acclaimed Hong Kong action director John Woo has created a delirious mix of spectacular gun battles, furious explosions and breathtaking stunts. John Travolta plays driven but anguished FBI agent Sean Archer, who is using the full force of his anti-terrorist unit to track down the psychotic criminal Castor Troy, energetically played by Nicolas Cage. Thinking he has finally killed Castor in a spectacular airport shootout, Archer is horrified to discover that he is in fact alive but in a coma. Undergoing a radical face-swapping procedure, Archer assumes Castor’s identity in an attempt to discover the Los Angeles location of a nerve gas bomb due to explode. When Castor awakens from his coma, he retaliates by infiltrating the real Archer’s life and destroying any evidence of the identity switch. Archer is thrust into a nightmare, where he must fight for his life and his family. This cat and mouse thriller was written by Mike Werb and Michael Colleary. Music by John Powell. Edited by Christian Wagner and Steven Kemper. Cinematography by Oliver Wood. Also stars Joan Allen, Alessandro Nivola, Gina Gershon, Dominique Swain and Nick Cassavetes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Woo, Barrie M Osborne, Christopher Goosick, David Permut, Terence Chang, Douglas Reuter Productions and WCG Entertainment

results.title: Beautiful girls
results.creator_credit: Ted Demme, Cary Woods, Miramax Films and Woods Entertainment
results.brief_description: A ten year high school reunion in a snowbound town is the setting for this exploration of how men’s lives are influenced by “beautiful girls”. Piano playing Willie (Hutton), former heartthrob Tommy (Dillon), his girlfriend Sharon (Sorvino), and his lover Darian (Holly) all gather with long lost friends for reminiscing and advice about relationships. Out of the group of friends, only Willie has moved away from the small New England town and is pursuing a career as a piano player. He is at a crossroads in his life, contemplating giving up his career for girlfriend Tracy (Annabeth Gish). His feelings are complicated by the presence of a captivating young girl next door (Natalie Portman).
